Research experience.Lab: Language Learning and Development Lab, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Research experience.Project: L2 English learners' phonetic adaptation to non-native accents.
Research experience.Role: Student lead, Doctoral trainee of NSERC Discovery Grant
Duties: Conducted literature review, developed research questions and hypotheses
Designed online experiment platform for perception studies using JsPschy
Created scripts in MatLab to generate acoustic continuums for fricatives using STRAIGHT toolkit
Collected and curated speech perception and production data from 420 native English speakers and Mandarin learners of English in Canada and China
Used Generalized Linear Mixed Effects Models to analyze perception data and performed Linear Discriminant Analysis on acoustics.
Developed a doctoral dissertation, 3 first-author manuscripts (1 submitted, 2 in preparation) and 2 conference presentations.

Research experience.Lab: Language Learning and Development Lab & Language and Brain Lab, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Research experience.PI/Co-Is: Dr. Henny Yeung, Dr. Yue Wang
Research experience.Role: Graduate trainee of NSERC and SSHRC Grant
Duties: Conducted literature review, developed research questions and hypotheses
Designed auditory stimuli in Mandarin and recorded visual stimuli
Coordinated and supervised the data collection of eye-tracking data from 72 monolingual English and bilingual English-Mandarin speakers.
Used Linear Mixed Effects Models to analyze fixation proportions, saccade amplitude and fixation latency, conducted Growth Curve Analysis on eye-gaze patterns
Mentored undergraduate students
Developed 3 first-author manuscripts (1 published, 1 in revision, 1 in preparation) and 2 conference presentations.
